circumstances: Donald Thomas, an 8-year-old with a history of chronic illness stress, was reported missing after last being seen near a river while on a family cruise ship. It is believed Donald wandered off due to the overwhelming stress he faced during the trip. At one point, he was sighted near Gallanach Road, PA34 4PE, raising concerns as the area is not far from a secluded cabin known to be in the vicinity. His grandmother and brother Adrian Webb were heavily involved in the search efforts, utilizing a nearby tutoring center as a temporary safe house for coordination. Thankfully, the authorities located him safely in Inverclyde after approximately two days.

circumstances: Donald Thomas, an 8-year-old boy with a disability, was reported missing from his home at 1 Customhouse Way. Concern arose when his grandmother went to check on him and found that he was not in his room. Despite a thorough search of the house and neighborhood, he was nowhere to be seen. Donald had earlier mentioned an interest in seeing the countryside, which led family members to speculate he may have attempted to explore beyond his usual confines. After several days of searches and appeals, authorities traced him to Glengallen Road, Oban. The police managed to locate him safe, although a bit shaken, at a local residence, where a kind passerby noticed he seemed confused and alerted the authorities.
